article.headline: Oil futures end with a loss, with U.S. prices down more than 3% for the week
article.body: Oil futures fell on Friday, sending U.S. prices down by more than 3% for the week as the increasing numbers of coronavirus cases looked to hamper a recovery in energy demand. August West Texas Intermediate oil clq20 fell 23 cents, or 0.6%, to settle at $38.49 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Based on the front-month contract, prices declined by 3.4% for the week, according to Dow Jones Market Data.
